properties.ariaLabel: the type of the nodeedge permalink

children.value: In G6 3.2.x and its previous versions, you can assign the type for edges and nodes in data, or assign them globally when instantiating the Graph, e.g.
// Assign the type of edges/nodes in data
// the type of this node is circle
// the type of this node is rect
// the type of this edge is polyline
// or assign them globally when instantiating the Graph
is comatible. But it will be discarded in the future).

The fontSize of label in G6 3.3 and G6 3.2.x will result in different visual sizes. But if you are using the default fontSize(12), there will be no difference. This is due to the unreasonable matrix tranformation for label in previous version of G6's rendering engine, which is resolved in G6 3.3. Now, the visual size is more reasonable and accurate.
In G6 3.2 and previous versions, you can add a shape to a custom node or edge as following without assign
// ... The attributes of the graphic shape
// ... The attributes of the graphic shape

when adding a shape. If not, the shapes will not response some interactive events. Adding these two property as below:

// Allow this shape to be dragged
// Not unique, you can assign any string value to it
// ... The attributes of the graphic shape
// Allow this shape to be dragged
// Not unique, you can assign any string value to it

In G6 3.2 and previous versions, you can assign the renderer with options options
for graph when instantiating the Graph.
In G6 3.3, to make a better version with canvas, we do not support SVG renderer temporary. But we will support it in the future.
